Articles.Content:
Accidentally put this ship into Kerbol orbit, and found a new planet!

Why yes, it is April 1. Hmm.
Is that EVE Online?

Heh. Yeah.

Poll suggestion: how many Kerbanauts are recovering Eve addicts?
I used to be one. Until I raged, at accidently loosing all my expensive implants -.-
Currently trying to juggle my KSP addiction with my PVP corp in eve...KSP is winning. 8)

Accidentally put this ship into Kerbol orbit, and found a new planet!

Why yes, it is April 1. Hmm.

Seems legit =P
I TOTALLY CAN\'T SEE THE PIXELS

I bet there would have been no problem if you had used Paint.NET\'s Magic Wand tool. That would have selected ALL the space. Then you just copy the image, paste it in a new layer above the EVE Online image, then you Merge Layer Down.
Your terrible sense of humour is superseded only by your terrible photoshop skills.

Your terrible sense of humour is superseded only by your terrible photoshop skills.

No.

Just... no

No.

Just... no

K. I\'ll stop that now.

The pixels are on purpose though. If had been willing to spend the time, I would have added some bits of tape!

Heh. Yeah.

Poll suggestion: how many Kerbanauts are recovering Eve addicts?

Who said I was recovering? I\'ve been flying around my new Vexor garbage scow like a fat bumble bee all over highsec the past few days, thanks to Damion.

:|

lol

Looks photoshopped though.

Who said I was recovering? I\'ve been flying around my new Vexor garbage scow like a fat bumble bee all over highsec the past few days, thanks to Damion.

:|

That\'s because you still haven\'t hit bottom. Although your description of the past few weeks sounds pretty close to hitting bottom, if you ask me. We might need to have an intervention for you.

I remember when I was flying around in a freighter. That taught me a lesson in the time value of money. It\'s not worth spending the better part of an hour to fly from one trade hub to the other when I could contract someone for a couple million (usually a couple hundred thousand) to do it for me. I eventually sold that freighter for a nice little profit. After making a couple billion ISK, I would lose motivation to play the game. My EVE friends got a nice monetary gift that christmas.

LOL

ps. Is that a picture art or a space simulator?

Currently trying to juggle my KSP addiction with my PVP corp in eve...KSP is winning. 8)

That\'s funny as I played EvE (years ago). A friend of mine has started to play KSP w/ me lately (also an ex-EvE player), and he said to me 'Imagine if EvE was precise like this, that\'d change a lot.' I said 'Yeah, but they\'d never do that, plus this game is better IMO.' ;D

That\'s funny as I played EvE (years ago). A friend of mine has started to play KSP w/ me lately (also an ex-EvE player), and he said to me 'Imagine if EvE was precise like this, that\'d change a lot.' I said 'Yeah, but they\'d never do that, plus this game is better IMO.' ;D

it goes to show its not always about graphics and explosions...I like ksp because its the closest I\'ll probably ever come to landing on the moon or going into orbit.

it goes to show its not always about graphics and explosions...I like ksp because its the closest I\'ll probably ever come to landing on the moon or going into orbit.

Landing on a moon in EVE was not very realistic. I remember when you could go to the center and be ejected out at great speeds. I would take a ship and bounce it off a station doing that. The day I bought my first freighter was a couple days after a patch that removed that effect :\'(. That would have been an epic bounce that would take eons to slow to a stop.

it goes to show its not always about graphics and explosions...I like ksp because its the closest I\'ll probably ever come to landing on the moon or going into orbit.

Yes, I prefer game-play over graphics (to an extent). That\'s the same reason why I like KSP also, probably as \'realistic\' as it gets for now. I like having to \'think\' to play and \'learn\' from my mishaps/mistakes, not just point & click.
